meanings.definition: Experience or be subjected to (something, typically something unpleasant)
meanings.sent1: She had to undergo a difficult surgery last week.
meanings.sent2: The patient will undergo a series of tests to determine the cause of the illness.
meanings.sent3: Despite her fear of heights, she had to undergo climbing the tall ladder.
meanings.sent4: The caterpillar undergoes a remarkable transformation into a butterfly.
meanings.sent5: The old house will undergo a complete renovation to restore its former glory.

meanings.sent1: He had to undergo a long and tiring journey to reach his destination.
meanings.sent2: The workers undergo harsh conditions in the factory every day.
meanings.sent3: The students had to undergo a boring lecture on a Friday afternoon.
meanings.sent4: The tree undergoes the harsh winter weather year after year.
meanings.sent5: The athlete will undergo intense training to prepare for the competition.
